intro: Paysonia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the roughleaf paysonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. It has a short lifespan and is considered an annual or biennial species. Paysonia lasiocarpa plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
